{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3157574,"name":"CoachC","username":"CoachC","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/coachc/{size}/8038_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-05T16:33:47.681Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone! We purchased the Andymark AM-2916 rgb led light strips for our bot but are not certain what the optimum set up and wiring are. Ive read multiple accounts of issues that can arise from wiring these to the VRM or roborio?

Looking for advice please.

Best of luck to all in 2023

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-03-05T16:33:47.681Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":52,"reads":165,"readers_count":164,"score":293.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":428993,"topic_slug":"rgb-light-strip","display_username":"CoachC","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24485,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rgb-light-strip/428993/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3157579,"name":"Justin","username":"justicht","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/justicht/{size}/244097_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-05T16:43:31.913Z","cooked":"

You’ll want power from the 5V/2A spot on the voltage regulator, then signal wire to the signal output on one of your PWM ports on the RIO.

And if you cut it under two feet you can probably solely connect it to the Rio.

See Is it possible to plug led strips into the roborio? - Technical / Programming - Chief Delphi

I am afraid though that the specs on AndyMark’s website might be wrong.

Both REV-11-1198 and am-2916 claim 60 LEDs per meter, and I assume that they both use WS2812B LEDs.

REV-11-1198 says it requires approximately 3 Amps per meter, so 15 W per meter.

am-2916 says power: 15 Watts, implying 15 W total, but it’s likely to be mistake and probably should read 15 W PER METER.

VRM can deliver 5V * 2A = 10W.

So two feet max is probably what one should aim at.

Page 20 of the CANdle manual is also a good source of info: CANdle User’s Guide (ctr-electronics.com)

The CANdle can deliver 6 Amps at 5 V, so 30 W, and the manual claims that it is typically enough for 300 LEDs.

At 60 LEDs per meter, the CANdle should therefore be able to drive 5 meters of am-2916.

That is not in line with the specs for the REV-11-1198 which says it uses 15 W per meter, and therefore suggests that the CANdle could only drive 2 meters.

But 8.2 feet is 2.5 meters, which is not that far from 2 meters, so I wouldn’t feel bad connecting a full am-2916 on CANdle regardless of which spec is correct.

For further reference, the Blinkin Blinkin LED Driver - REV Robotics does 5 Amps at 5 V, so 25 W and only claims it can drive a full REV-11-1198 which is only one meter long. Connecting a full am-2916 to it might be pushing it a bit too far.
